intro: Glossorhyncha brachychaete, commonly known as the short-stemmed horned plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, horn-like structures on its stems. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Glossorhyncha brachychaete is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
